title: Account Takeover using Third party Auth CSRF
content:
Login to your account at demo.weblate.org
Goto Profile > Authentication - https://demo.weblate.org/accounts/profile/#auth
In Add new association section , select Ubuntu
Login with Ubuntu One account , before clicking on Yes log me in on ubuntu authentication site , start a proxy tool like Burp and intercept the request.

Attacker's Ubuntu account will be connected to victim , the attacker can then use login with Ubuntu and access victim's account.
steps: Login to your account at demo.weblate.org and navigate to Profile > Authentication.
Intercept the authentication request using a proxy tool like Burp when adding a new association with Ubuntu.
Create a CSRF form with the intercepted request data and trick the victim into submitting it.
Upon submission, the attacker's Ubuntu account will be linked to the victim's account, allowing account takeover.
vuln_description: This vulnerability allows an attacker to perform an account takeover by exploiting a CSRF flaw in the third-party authentication process (Ubuntu One) on demo.weblate.org. By tricking a victim into submitting a malicious form, the attacker can associate their own Ubuntu account with the victim's Weblate account, gaining unauthorized access.
reason: The attack requires understanding of both the OAuth/OpenID flow and CSRF exploitation techniques. While the components (intercepting requests, crafting CSRF forms) are standard security testing practices, the specific interaction between the third-party auth and the application's session handling adds some complexity.
